title: Hikarigama
content:
Type design for gallery exhibition titled   
"Hikarigama" (which is a japanese style wood fired kiln   
used for making pottery) ![Hikarigama type](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023082647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/21460.jpg)
author: designalchemy

comments.content:
Ole: I like! The letterforms are very illustrative. The "A" reminds me of a sumo wrestler and the "M" looks like a Japanese arch. The i is a little dull compared to the other letters. And the bottom stroke of the G seems a little flat and the connection is awkward. How would it look if the G had a vertical bar sort of like the horizontal double bars of the H and K? Also, did you intend for some strokes to be slightly thinner than others? Perhaps it is just the screen.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023082647im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/29/21463.gif)
i love your hikarigama go right ahead

Hi Ole. Enjoyable letterforms. Nice work.   
   
I wonder how it would look without the lines underneath?
